author: frederic.olenczak
title: E-ROW waterways transportation
description: Millions of people are commuting daily in Africa using fossil energies which makes the cost of transport high, second expense per household.

assessments.note: Whilst this would add users, it seems the use of Cardano is a side issue here. How many pontoon do they expect to deploy. Is this significant in terms of number of users for Cardano?

While high transportation cost are no doubt a valid problem,  the proposal does not offer a clear solution. The proposed concept is geographically limited and does not reflect an understanding of the technological and economic limitations of such a transformation. A tremendous investment would be required before the project would significantly impact Cardano usage in Africa.

The idea of a different solution other than fossile energy sounds great. But the proposal doesn't make it as clear why there is funding necessairy except from using Cardano as a payment channel. It would be nice to have more detail how this proposal tracks the number of users, how it rewards the entrepreneurs and end users and give the first step for blockchain into inland transportations. The proposal has the ability to scale but it doesn't have to.

The idea is very good in terms of impacting the inhabitants of Africa, since it promises to develop a way to generate cheaper energy and cleaner too, which would be ecologically interesting. As water transport is already a common practice in the region, the author can see a way to enhance a present practice and add it with a new benefit. In this way, the project would rather benefit the inhabitants (many would be involved, a mobilization would not be necessary to attract people) and the locality, in addition to representing a solution that mainly meets the adequacy requirement. It also involves the activities of the Cardano project during the monetary transactions of boat trips, as he explains in his detailed plan.
The idea is original and could provide a more fuel independent solution for african waterways traffic. It was not entirely clear in the proposal wether Cardano would be used to buy or rent a boat.

I can see some potential here in relation to challenge being targeted but am not fully convinced by the submission at this stage. The proposer perhaps needs to revisit the community and collaborate further to adapt this project to specific use case.

Inland waterways are used in a substantial manner in South Sudan to overcome the limitations of poor road infrastructure. The initiate to use solar-powered boats with payment in Cardano is revolutionary and will help the overall
The proposers have not yet looking into the key issue of connecting the smart pontoons to the Cardano network. Do they have internet access?

The experience of the proposer is limited to working in the field of river transport. Are there any technical people in the team that have experience around blockchain. This would certainly help. There is a roadmap but it is kind of vague. The same goes for the budget it would be nice to be a little more accurate. It feels like the proposal tries to achieve a lot but has not yet figured out a clear path.

The author of the proposal has attached a website that contains a lot of information about the activity, as well as a page that shows who the people involved are and what they do. Thus, a lot of security is passed on to the team, which apparently already has experience in what it does, and manages to demonstrate this in a precise and objective way.

The project aims to start with small piloting projects before scaling up. This enables a more solid aproach. The website states that E-ROW already has a running project in Togo and including information on this as reference as to how operations are faring there would create an extra perspective on feasibility. The requested budget is very small for such an undertaking and there are doubts that it would cover the costs.

The proposer seems to have excellent experience in terms of electric boat transport but needs to make the alignment between this and a specific example (especially in the promote Africa challenge). I feel with further refinement and collaboration the plan will improve to make a good case for funding.

The proposal is ambitious and has a large number of risks. Solar Impulse Foundation is a large organization with an aim to get government funding. With this backdrop, it can be assumed that the proposal will be implemented in earnest.
Mor einofrmation should be provided on how many smart pontoons are expected to be provided and thus how many people this project will drive to the Cardano platform.

A more feasible and auditable proposal would include details of the proposed government grant, Choice of a specific pilot location where average trip lengths fit within the limitation of battery power. Detailed discussion of the potential output of the turbine unit in the chosen location. Detailed discussion of the cost of conversion of battery powered boats. Detailed timeline of how 50k users will be achieved in the proposed 6 month period.

The proposal includes all the necessary informations but keeps it at a minimum. The whole proposal could be more detailed and after reading it as a CA you do not really have a clear picture. It is an ambitious proposal which comes with a lot of risks. A risk assessment but have been beneficial.

It includes stages that the project will go through in order to materialize, as well as a division explaining how the funding would be used, in percentage, for what purpose. We are also told the expectation of how the project would be impacting the lives of local residents (according to the data provided, 50K people would be using water transport in 6 months). Therefore, I believe that the project is well planned, very detailed in relation to an action plan and expectations to be achieved.

The proposal contains much information, but is not formatted in seperate sections which makes it hard to find targetted information. It could be made much clearer if it were to contain titles and sections. I'm missing some information on how the project would be imposed (how to get the equipment there etc.. ) to determine if the rtequested funding would be adequate.

The information provided is sufficient however, it appears this proposal is still in the early development stage. Due to this I cannot yet see the suitability of the proposal for funding. I underline at this stage because with further attention this may become a very suitable project.
The proposal is a simple to use of Cardano as a token for payment in a solar-powered boat. it will be possible to audit the progress and measure the success.

solution: Smart grid pontoon recharge electric boat by using kinetic energy of water. Customer pay with token to local entrepreneur and get rewarded.
experience:
Smart grid pontoon create enough energy to recharge boat and modules in the most predictable way.
